00053   .section  .exception, "ax", @progbits
00054 
00055 
00056 // Start of Exception Vector Table.
00057 
00058   // EVBA must be aligned with a power of two strictly greater than the EVBA-
00059   // relative offset of the last vector.
00060   .balign 0x200
00061 
00062   // Export symbol.
00063   .global _evba
00064   .type _evba, @function
00065 _evba:
00066 
00067         .org  0x000
00068         // Unrecoverable Exception.
00069 _handle_Unrecoverable_Exception:
00070         rjmp $
00071 
00072         .org  0x004
00073         // TLB Multiple Hit: UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00074 _handle_TLB_Multiple_Hit:
00075         rjmp $
00076 
00077         .org  0x008
00078         // Bus Error Data Fetch.
00079 _handle_Bus_Error_Data_Fetch:
00080         rjmp $
00081 
00082         .org  0x00C
00083          // Bus Error Instruction Fetch.
00084 _handle_Bus_Error_Instruction_Fetch:
00085         rjmp $
00086 
00087         .org  0x010
00088         // NMI.
00089 _handle_NMI:
00090         lda.w   pc, eic_nmi_handler
00091 
00092         .org  0x014
00093         // Instruction Address.
00094 _handle_Instruction_Address:
00095         rjmp $
00096 
00097         .org  0x018
00098         // ITLB Protection.
00099 _handle_ITLB_Protection:
00100         rjmp $
00101 
00102         .org  0x01C
00103         // Breakpoint.
00104 _handle_Breakpoint:
00105         rjmp $
00106 
00107         .org  0x020
00108         // Illegal Opcode.
00109 _handle_Illegal_Opcode:
00110         rjmp $
00111 
00112         .org  0x024
00113         // Unimplemented Instruction.
00114 _handle_Unimplemented_Instruction:
00115         rjmp $
00116 
00117         .org  0x028
00118         // Privilege Violation.
00119 _handle_Privilege_Violation:
00120         rjmp $
00121 
00122         .org  0x02C
00123         // Floating-Point: UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00124 _handle_Floating_Point:
00125         rjmp $
00126 
00127         .org  0x030
00128         // Coprocessor Absent: UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00129 _handle_Coprocessor_Absent:
00130         rjmp $
00131 
00132         .org  0x034
00133         // Data Address (Read).
00134 _handle_Data_Address_Read:
00135         rjmp $
00136 
00137         .org  0x038
00138         // Data Address (Write).
00139 _handle_Data_Address_Write:
00140         rjmp $
00141 
00142         .org  0x03C
00143         // DTLB Protection (Read).
00144 _handle_DTLB_Protection_Read:
00145         rjmp $
00146 
00147         .org  0x040
00148         // DTLB Protection (Write).
00149 _handle_DTLB_Protection_Write:
00150         rjmp $
00151 
00152         .org  0x044
00153         // DTLB Modified: UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00154 _handle_DTLB_Modified:
00155         rjmp $
00156 
00157         .org  0x050
00158         // ITLB Miss: UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00159 _handle_ITLB_Miss:
00160         rjmp $
00161 
00162         .org  0x060
00163         // DTLB Miss (Read): UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00164 _handle_DTLB_Miss_Read:
00165         rjmp $
00166 
00167         .org  0x070
00168         // DTLB Miss (Write): UNUSED IN AVR32UC.
00169 _handle_DTLB_Miss_Write:
00170         rjmp $
00171 
00172         .org  0x100
00173         // Supervisor Call.
00174 _handle_Supervisor_Call:
00175         rjmp $

00177 
00178 // Interrupt support.
00179 // The interrupt controller must provide the offset address relative to EVBA.
00180 // Important note:
00181 //   All interrupts call a C function named _get_interrupt_handler.
00182 //   This function will read group and interrupt line number to then return in
00183 //   R12 a pointer to a user-provided interrupt handler.
00184 
00185   .balign 4
00186 
00187 _int0:
00188   // R8-R12, LR, PC and SR are automatically pushed onto the system stack by the
00189   // CPU upon interrupt entry.
00190 #if 1 // B1832: interrupt stack changed to exception stack if exception is detected.
00191   mfsr    r12, AVR32_SR
00192   bfextu  r12, r12, AVR32_SR_M0_OFFSET, AVR32_SR_M0_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M1_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M2_SIZE
00193   cp.w    r12, 0b110
00194   brlo    _int0_normal
00195   lddsp   r12, sp[0 * 4]
00196   stdsp   sp[6 * 4], r12
00197   lddsp   r12, sp[1 * 4]
00198   stdsp   sp[7 * 4], r12
00199   lddsp   r12, sp[3 * 4]
00200   sub     sp, -6 * 4
00201   rete
00202 _int0_normal:
00203 #endif
00204   mov     r12, 0  // Pass the int_lev parameter to the _get_interrupt_handler function.
00205   call    _get_interrupt_handler
00206   cp.w    r12, 0  // Get the pointer to the interrupt handler returned by the function.
00207   movne   pc, r12 // If this was not a spurious interrupt (R12 != NULL), jump to the handler.
00208   rete            // If this was a spurious interrupt (R12 == NULL), return from event handler.
00209 
00210 _int1:
00211   // R8-R12, LR, PC and SR are automatically pushed onto the system stack by the
00212   // CPU upon interrupt entry.
00213 #if 1 // B1832: interrupt stack changed to exception stack if exception is detected.
00214   mfsr    r12, AVR32_SR
00215   bfextu  r12, r12, AVR32_SR_M0_OFFSET, AVR32_SR_M0_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M1_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M2_SIZE
00216   cp.w    r12, 0b110
00217   brlo    _int1_normal
00218   lddsp   r12, sp[0 * 4]
00219   stdsp   sp[6 * 4], r12
00220   lddsp   r12, sp[1 * 4]
00221   stdsp   sp[7 * 4], r12
00222   lddsp   r12, sp[3 * 4]
00223   sub     sp, -6 * 4
00224   rete
00225 _int1_normal:
00226 #endif
00227   mov     r12, 1  // Pass the int_lev parameter to the _get_interrupt_handler function.
00228   call    _get_interrupt_handler
00229   cp.w    r12, 0  // Get the pointer to the interrupt handler returned by the function.
00230   movne   pc, r12 // If this was not a spurious interrupt (R12 != NULL), jump to the handler.
00231   rete            // If this was a spurious interrupt (R12 == NULL), return from event handler.
00232 
00233 _int2:
00234   // R8-R12, LR, PC and SR are automatically pushed onto the system stack by the
00235   // CPU upon interrupt entry.
00236 #if 1 // B1832: interrupt stack changed to exception stack if exception is detected.
00237   mfsr    r12, AVR32_SR
00238   bfextu  r12, r12, AVR32_SR_M0_OFFSET, AVR32_SR_M0_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M1_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M2_SIZE
00239   cp.w    r12, 0b110
00240   brlo    _int2_normal
00241   lddsp   r12, sp[0 * 4]
00242   stdsp   sp[6 * 4], r12
00243   lddsp   r12, sp[1 * 4]
00244   stdsp   sp[7 * 4], r12
00245   lddsp   r12, sp[3 * 4]
00246   sub     sp, -6 * 4
00247   rete
00248 _int2_normal:
00249 #endif
00250   mov     r12, 2  // Pass the int_lev parameter to the _get_interrupt_handler function.
00251   call    _get_interrupt_handler
00252   cp.w    r12, 0  // Get the pointer to the interrupt handler returned by the function.
00253   movne   pc, r12 // If this was not a spurious interrupt (R12 != NULL), jump to the handler.
00254   rete            // If this was a spurious interrupt (R12 == NULL), return from event handler.
00255 
00256 _int3:
00257   // R8-R12, LR, PC and SR are automatically pushed onto the system stack by the
00258   // CPU upon interrupt entry.
00259 #if 1 // B1832: interrupt stack changed to exception stack if exception is detected.
00260   mfsr    r12, AVR32_SR
00261   bfextu  r12, r12, AVR32_SR_M0_OFFSET, AVR32_SR_M0_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M1_SIZE + AVR32_SR_M2_SIZE
00262   cp.w    r12, 0b110
00263   brlo    _int3_normal
00264   lddsp   r12, sp[0 * 4]
00265   stdsp   sp[6 * 4], r12
00266   lddsp   r12, sp[1 * 4]
00267   stdsp   sp[7 * 4], r12
00268   lddsp   r12, sp[3 * 4]
00269   sub     sp, -6 * 4
00270   rete
00271 _int3_normal:
00272 #endif
00273   mov     r12, 3  // Pass the int_lev parameter to the _get_interrupt_handler function.
00274   call    _get_interrupt_handler
00275   cp.w    r12, 0  // Get the pointer to the interrupt handler returned by the function.
00276   movne   pc, r12 // If this was not a spurious interrupt (R12 != NULL), jump to the handler.
00277   rete            // If this was a spurious interrupt (R12 == NULL), return from event handler.
00278 
00279 
00280 // Constant data area.
00281 
00282   .balign 4
00283 
00284   // Values to store in the interrupt priority registers for the various interrupt priority levels.
00285   // The interrupt priority registers contain the interrupt priority level and
00286   // the EVBA-relative interrupt vector offset.
00287   .global ipr_val
00288   .type ipr_val, @object
00289 ipr_val:
00290   .word (INT0 << AVR32_INTC_IPR0_INTLEV_OFFSET) | (_int0 - _evba),\
00291         (INT1 << AVR32_INTC_IPR0_INTLEV_OFFSET) | (_int1 - _evba),\
00292         (INT2 << AVR32_INTC_IPR0_INTLEV_OFFSET) | (_int2 - _evba),\
00293         (INT3 << AVR32_INTC_IPR0_INTLEV_OFFSET) | (_int3 - _evba)
00294
